author: Staff Reporter
text:
CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury said here on Sunday that the Pathankot attack had put a question mark on Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s claim of a “robust government.”

Addressing the gathering at the 50th anniversary of CPI(M)’s mouthpiece Ganashakti on Sunday, Mr. Yechury said despite the Centre’s claim on Saturday that all the terrorists at the air base had been eliminated it was later known that two more terrorists are inside the base.

“Mr. Modi claims that discussions with Pakistan have resumed. Then why are such attacks still taking place and who is responsible for this,” Mr. Yechury asked here on Sunday.

The attack exposed the “weak points within the security and intelligence,” he added.
title: Modi’s claims exposed: CPI(M)
